title: What would happen if I stopped using my phone completely for 1-2 weeks? - Quora

response.answer_text: depends on what kind of person you are, but i can share my experience with it. my phones regularly break(i'm currently on my 5th phone since januari.). last time, i was short on money so i couldnt buy a new one immediately. i was phoneless for about 3 weeks, and it was absolute bliss. the first 2 or 3 days i felt a bit lonely, but i soon found other things to fill up this empty space. i read a lot, practiced bass as if my life depended on it, and meditated. after a few more days i realised i felt more at peace without constant notifications, messages and calls. i had a lot more “me-time", if you will.

It would not matter much for the phone. For you, it depends on your personality. If you have goals and use the phone mostly to reach your goals, then you would suffer. If you are using the phone mostly to use up your boring free time, then you would benefit from not using your phone. It is a great thing to get bored. Then you can go and find some useful activities for yourself.

Nothing magical, if that’s what you’re asking. I suppose if you wanted to talk to someone you’d either have to do it in person or over a computer, or by letter if you’d like. Your phone plan might be cheaper depending on how you were billed for usage. Other than that not a lot of would change.

Nothing, except that you would not have whatever experiences you would have had using it during that time and you would have others instead. That might include consequences for being out of touch with your family, friends, and/or employer.
